newsitem.title: USA: FPC denies Fla. nuke restarting in January.
newsitem.headline: FPC denies Fla. nuke restarting in January.

text.p: Florida Power Corp said its 860 megawatt (MW) Crystal River 3 nuclear unit, shut September 2 for repairs, will not restart in January as reported by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC).
"We won't be restarting in January. There's no restart date yet," a company spokeswoman said.
The NRC said in its Thursday report on the status of the nation's nuclear power plants that the Crystal River unit was expected to restart January 17.
The company had earlier reported that the unit might return to service sometime in January.
The unit, in Red Level, Fla., was shut to repair a lubricating oil pipeline to the unit's main turbine generator.
FPC is the main subsidiary of Florida Progress Corp and serves 1.3 million customers in central and northern Florida.
